Message:
I spoke about "Rising Opportunities..." in our beloved country in a speech at the University of Cape Coast last Thursday. In that speech, I outlined to the audience how Ghana has started changing over the last few years in line with my government's Agenda for Transformation. 

Wherever I visit during my travels across the country, I see a nation filled with an energetic, innovative and promising youth, ready and willing to take advantage of the rising opportunities government is creating together with the private sector.

Our Country, Ghana, is changing and the change is solid and transformational because it is backed by the implementation of sound and deliberate policies and programmes which I am leading as President.

This change is not by accident. We are doing the right things. And that is why I commend you for your sacrifices, fortitude and hard work over the period.
Together we are #Changinglives and #TransformingGhana.
story: John Dramani Mahama added 7 new photos.

Message:
"I was 3 years old, and my father sent for me to come to Accra from the Northern village where I used to live with my mother. We were in this car, my mother and I, and my father’s driver kept driving as if all this was perfectly normal. We were sitting in the back of the car. She was silent, she kept looking over the window – and I was lost. I thought the world was going to end. I knew that once we arrived in Accra she would return to her village up in the north. I thought I would never see her again.

And then slowly, very slowly, I gradually began to understand how deep my mother’s love for me was. I understood that she will always be there for me, no matter what. Suddenly, the silence stopped being frightening. It became warm like a promise that everything was going to be alright."

This is for my mother, Abiba Nnaba, and for all Ghanaian mothers. 
May God bless you every single day, from the day you were born till the end of eternity! 
May the patient, unconditional, unselfish love with which you protect us and believe in us return to you even stronger, even wider!

JM.
Sometimes as politicians, we think that we are bigger than this country and you must always remember to cut us down to size and let us know that this country will exist long after we are gone.

I will be speaking on 'Rising Opportunities, Entrepreneurship & A Changing Ghana' at 8pm tomorrow at the National Examinations Centre of the University of Cape Coast. 

#ChangingLives
#TransformingGhana

Today, I began my Accounting to the People tour of the Central Region with a courtesy call on the Chiefs of the Oguaa Traditional Council. In the next three days, I will be engaging a number of chiefs in various traditional areas of the region, pay working visits to a number of project sites including the Kotokuraba Market, the Komenda Sugar Factory, the Elmina Bridge and the Twifo Praso Hospital. I will also cut sod for the start of work on a new polyclinic at Dawurampong and a new market at Bontrese. 

#ChangingLives 
#TransformingGhana

A few hours ago, I joined the people of Cape Coast and the Central Region to officially open the new 16,000 capacity Cape Coast Stadium, built by the People's Republic of China in response to an appeal by our late leader, President John Evans Atta Mills. 

#ChangingLives
#TransformingGhana
story: John Dramani Mahama added 5 new photos.

Message:
Today we celebrate World Press Freedom Day. In Ghana, we pride ourselves with one of the freest press in the world. This speaks volumes about our commitment to democracy and transparency. The plurality of voices, the strong and healthy debates and the thorough journalistic investigations, all provide a milieu where every voice is heard and where every branch of the the government is held accountable to citizens.

As someone who understands communication, I stand in full appreciation for the freedom of speech, but also for the decency with which we choose to communicate so that we don’t instill hate in our fellow-citizens’ souls, but rather a passion towards the truth. 

Our press has a fundamental mission: to seek the truth and to protect the dignity and decency of every Ghanaian. On this day, I say to all Ghanaian journalists: Ayeeko! I thank each and every one of you for your dedication! I will always be your partner on our common path towards a better Ghana!

My brothers and sisters, the gallant workers of Mother Ghana, 
You are the salt of the earth. You bring hope to all of us. 
Your constant efforts are part of a transformational process which is taking place on many levels. Without your dedication and resilience, our transformation agenda will be meaningless. This is why everything we have achieved so far - better access to education, better access to water and electricity, better access to medical facilities, better roads, better agriculture - is, first and foremost, your achievement. 

You contributed decisively to our common effort, and it is only fair for you to be rewarded accordingly. Thanks to you, our economy is currently expanding and will grow even more significantly in 2017. This will most certainly mean more jobs and more money into your pockets. 

I am in full solidarity with all Ghanaian workers, as I have always been. 

Stand proud of your achievements! Protect them! Multiply them! 

Thanks to your dedication, OUR children’s future is looking BRIGHTER than ever!

Happy Workers Day, and May God bless us all!

Get your first ever Voter ID Card by registering as a voter between now and May 08. 

Be a part of Ghana's democratic journey. 

It's your right! 
Get your First Voter ID Card and be eligible to vote on November 07, 2016. 
#JM 2016
NA
story: John Dramani Mahama added a new photo.

Message:
I swore a new Central Bank Governor, Dr. Abdul Nashiru Issahaku, into office on Monday. 

We expect a lot from the new Governor and his team. The economic prospects of our country look extremely good, and this has been confirmed by the World Bank and other institutions. 

Government will keep the strict fiscal discipline necessary to reap all the benefits from these new levels of expected growth. 

You can be assured that government will continue to stay on the path towards economic progress!
story: John Dramani Mahama added 3 new photos.

Message:
During my “Accounting to the People” tour, I spent some special days with the people from Volta Region. The Volta Region continues to demonstrate its great love for me and my administration.

I inaugurated the 46.4km Eastern Corridor Road from Dodo Pepesu to Nkwanta, and also inspected work on the Dapa- Pampawie- Ahamasu Junction which is being executed under the Cocoa Roads Improvement Project.

I also participated at a ceremony at Dambai to mark the completion of the Worawora- Dambai Road. From there I went to Chinderi, also in the northern part of the region, where a new Community Day Senior High School was built and fully equipped.

I am humbled by the support from the people for our developmental projects. Ghana is changing before our very own eyes, and we all feel empowered by this transformation.
story: John Dramani Mahama added 10 new photos.

Message:
While in the Eastern Region, as part of my Accounting to the People tour, I assured the people of my responsibility to build a solid foundation for Ghana. A solid foundation provides us all with more opportunities, and this is why I remain focused on developmental and transformational projects.

Many road projects have been completed and efforts are being made to also improve access to safe drinking water and quality healthcare in the region. Work is underway to solve the water problem in the Kwahu area and also provide the area with new health facilities. 

Ghana is progressing towards a better future and every Ghanaian will have a better life tomorrow.

I thank you all for accompanying me in this transformational 
journey.

#ChhangingLives
#TransformingGhana
story: John Dramani Mahama added 16 new photos.

Message: NA
story: John Dramani Mahama updated their profile picture.

Message:
All Ghanaians have the right to access information – it is a fundamental right, guaranteed by our Constitution. As President, I therefore have the obligation to inform all of you about my Government’s projects, their stage of execution and their purposes.

I have since 2013 focused on accountability and transparency. This is why I started the Accounting to the People tour. I chose this approach because it gives me the chance to focus on each and every region, and to get direct feedback from all of you.

Together we are building the 21st Century Ghana, and we all need to have a clear picture of what we have achieved so far, and what remains to be done. 

Thank you all for your valuable insights, and for your strong confidence in our common future. May God bless all of you!

#ChangingLives 
#TransformingGhana

As I prepare to enter the Eastern Region on Tuesday on the second leg of my Accounting to the People Tour, I also want to join in the public education campaign to encourage all who have never registered to vote, to take advantage of the limited registration exercise of the Electoral Commission.
NA
story: John Dramani Mahama added a new photo.

Message:
I am on the second day of my 'Accounting to the People' tour of the Western Region, and earlier today, I inspected one of the 6 newly built cold stores across the coast, at New Takoradi. I took the opportunity to interact with members of the community and inspected a sea defence project. I have also visited Shama and inaugurated the cold store and refrigeration network built for the community. 

See more photos here: https://www.flickr.com/photos/fhcommsbureau/albums/72157664520810423/with/26227911126/
story: John Dramani Mahama added 3 new photos.

Message:
At the Takoradi Polytechnic yesterday, I launched the Initiative to convert the country's polytechnics into Technical Universities. Six of the ten Polytechnics that have so far qualified to be converted will become technical universities starting this academic year, and following the passage of the Technical Universities Bill by Parliament.  

Click here to watch a video of yesterday's ceremony. 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rHyrnER4WIw
story: John Dramani Mahama added 3 new photos.

Message:
I had the opportunity to meet with two more of my Facebook friends, Cross and Magdalene. We talked about a number of issues and about their future. 

I look forward to meeting many more of you via my Meet JM App in the next few weeks.

I spoke against self-doubt and the need to believe in the future of our country when I joined the Lighthouse family at their Good Friday Miracle Service. 

Click below to watch.
NA
story: John Dramani Mahama added a new photo.

Message:
I bring you a message of Easter.

Easter marks the death and resurrection of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ. It also marks his sacrifice to save the rest of mankind.

On behalf of the Government and People, I want to use the occasion of the Light House Chapel’s Crusade to express my best wishes to all Ghanaian Christians all over the country.

May the spirit of Easter mark a new beginning for our country, Ghana.
story: John Dramani Mahama added 10 new photos.

Message: NA
story: John Dramani Mahama added a new photo.

Message:
Thank you all for the messages. 
Thanks also to the University of Aberdeen for the honour done me and Ghanaians all over the globe. 
It is indeed a great honour, but I wish to remain & be addressed as Mr. John Dramani Mahama and not Dr. Mahama. 
Thanks. 
--- JM

"Let me express, on behalf of the good people of Ghana, my wife Lordina and my family, appreciation to the Faculty and Staff for this recognition and honour done me. I consider this an honour for all Ghanaians and it is a reflection of the strides we have made as a people, both internationally and at home. I therefore dedicate this Doctor of Laws honorary degree to the people of Ghana." 

--- Excerpts from my speech at the Special Graduation Ceremony of the University of Aberdeen.
story: John Dramani Mahama added 3 new photos.

Message:
Had the chance to meet 2 of my young friends who contacted me through my Facebook App, Meet JM. 
Their ideas were so inspiring, and their social knowledge admirable! 
I am looking forward to meeting many other young, progressive, inspirational people in the coming weeks.

I visited the Scottish Parliament for the first time today, and held very fruitful discussions with First Minister Nicola Sturgeon MSP and the Presiding Officer, Rt Hon Tricia Marwick MSP. 

In my address to a meeting of Members of the House, I noted among others that, "Africa is an emerging continent with a fast growing population. We are therefore a continent in a hurry. A ticking youth bulge requires that we speed up the process of economic growth in order that we can provide decent jobs for the large number of young people graduating from our schools. Accelerated economic growth, expansion of manufacturing and agriculture will guarantee jobs and stop the risky flow of young Africans across the Mediterranean in search of new opportunities in Europe." 

See more photos at: https://www.flickr.com/photos/fhcommsbureau/albums/72157665896805381
story: John Dramani Mahama added 5 new photos.

Message:
"It gives me immense joy to know that there are fellow Ghanaians who would go to any length to sacrifice their personal comfort to invest in such a bold initiative as the establishment of our first private medical school.

Professor Kwawukume and his team first established a Hospital, then a Nursing School which has trained so many nursing assistants and they have now committed their resources in establishing Ghana’s first Private Medical School."

--- President JD Mahama speaking at the maiden matriculation of the Family Health Medical School at Teshie-Nugua in the Greater Accra Region. 

Click here for the full speech: http://presidency.gov.gh/node/1159
Click for photos:https://www.flickr.com/photos/fhcommsbureau/albums/72157665806272852
story: John Dramani Mahama added 3 new photos.

Message:
Ghana, our happy home. 
As always, our victories over the challenges that confront the nation have put us in a better position than before. 
This, my fellow Ghanaians, is my strongest reason for the hope I have in this country.  
We shall overcome!

I invite you to watch my interview on TV3"s New Day Show, and look forward to more of such engagements with the people of Ghana. 



Click below to view Part 1 of the interview and other parts- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mtdQ2zBro4c

I have been informed of the death of Comedian, Bob Okalla. 
He brought joy to many homes, and of course to Lordina & I. 
#RIPBobOkalla

I had the opportunity on Saturday to join the old students, staff and students of the Holy Child Senior High School to commemorate their 70th Anniversary.  

An impressive school regimental band & cadet corps, and a perfect example of what old students can do to support their alma mater. Congratulations to the Old Hopsans for the projects and initiatives to help improve teaching and learning in the school. 

Click below for more photos. 
https://www.flickr.com/photos/fhcommsbureau/albums/72157663513219273
story: John Dramani Mahama added 4 new photos.

Message: NA
story: John Dramani Mahama added a new photo.

Message:
The young people of this country are our most important transformational force. But they need support, and one of my top priorities was, and will continue to be, to provide such support.

In addition to many already introduced interventions including the YES Initiative, the Skills Development Fund and the new Youth Employment Agency, I have just launched a new project to construct new facilities for 10 Technical Institutes across the country. This will position the Institutes to deliver quality technical and vocational training to our young people. 

Across the nation, 1,050 students have also been awarded bursaries in various technical and vocational institutions. This is to make it possible for them to continue and complete their technical education. 2000 apprentices have been awarded with bursaries in the informal sector that allows them to be placed in industry and learn on the job to qualify as master craftsmen, and later set up their own workshops. 
 
Together we are #ChangingLives and #TransformingGhana!
story: John Dramani Mahama added 6 new photos.

Message:
A new seven member Governing Council for the National African Peer Review Mechanism (APRM) has been sworn into office, chaired by Professor Akilagpa Sawyerr.
 
Other members of the Council are Professor Henrietta Mensa-Bonsu, Executive Director of the Legon Center for International Affairs and Diplomacy (LECIAD), Professor Kwesi Botchwey, Chairman of the National Development Planning Commission (NDPC) and Most Rev. Prof. Emmanuel Asante, Chairman of the National Peace Council.
 
The rest are Dr. Lawrence Kannae, Vice Chairman of the Public Services Commission, Mr. Richard Quayson, Acting Commissioner of the Commission on Human Rights and Administrative Justice (CHRAJ) and Mr. Samuel Asare Akuamoah, Acting Chairperson of the National Commission for Civic Education (NCCE).
President John Dramani Mahama uses the second stanza of the National Anthem to conclude his 59th Independence Day Address at the Black Star Square on 6th March, 2016.

We had a colourful and picturesque independence day parade at the Black Star Square today. And as I said in my address today, "The name “Ghana” means something in the world outside of our national borders. It represents a kinship, a determination, a disposition, a resolve, perseverance, dignity and integrity."

Happy 59th.
story: John Dramani Mahama added 5 new photos.

Message:
We are 59. 
Happy Anniversary my dear brothers and sisters.
From 7am this morning, we'll all gather at the Black Star Square for the parade to celebrate our 59th Independence Anniversary.

59 years ago, Ghana became an independent nation. Since then, we have, in keeping with our independence looked forward, and never backwards. We'll continue to work to transform our economy and our people.  

Independence is also a state of mind: it is about me and you and every Ghanaian. 

So show your pride and use this: https://apps.facebook.com/proud-of-ghana/

Over time, Turkey and Ghana have forged a relationship that reflects a partnership among equals. The visit of Turkey's President, HE Recep Tayyip Erdogan, has made this partnership stronger.

We signed four agreements on promotion and protection of Investments, on cooperation in sports, on cooperation in the field of communications, and on cooperation in the energy area. These four agreements prove that the relationship between Ghana and Turkey is a partnership for the 21st century.

As a symbol of this deepened partnership, President Erdogan and I cut the sod for a new project, the Terminal 3 building at the Kotoka International Airport. 

Starting a new project is always emotional, especially when the project is transformational. This is why I strongly believe that the friendship between Ghana and Turkey will be enhanced by this new project, to the benefit of both our great nations.
story: John Dramani Mahama added 16 new photos.

Message: President Uhuru Kenyatta of Kenya & President José Mário Vaz of Guinea Bissau are my guests at the 59th Independence Day Parade on Sunday at the Black Star Square.

I have always believed in the tremendous power that exists within every single Ghanaian: the power to influence the course of events and the power to shape the future of this great nation of ours. It is with this belief that I took office as President four years ago, and it is with this same belief that last week I delivered my State of the Nation Address.

The opposition is exercising its democratic right to criticize, which is a proof that we are living in a healthy democracy. However, it would be wrong to try to minimize our achievements and the depth of Ghana’s transformation in the last three years. For me, as President, these last three years are a story of hope– a hope shared by so many of us. This is because what we have been able to achieve so far is for all of us, and it was made possible only through the continuous participation of all of us.

The most important fact about the transformative stories I shared last week, the most fundamental truth about them is that they are not my achievements, they are our achievements! 
They are Ghana’s achievements! 

Step by step, we built something important, something that lays the foundation for irreversible improvements in the lives of all of us! We worked hard every day, we kept the faith, we kept moving forward – this is how we achieved all this!

Together we are changing lives, one individual at a time. These are our achievements! 

This is why I will keep talking about them – because when I talk about them I am honouring each and every one of you!

I look forward to my meetings with President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey when he arrives in Accra tomorrow. We will be discussing many issues of interest to our two nations, address a business and investment forum and cut the sod for the official start of work on a new terminal building at the Kotoka International Airport. 

Akwaaba to Ghana, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan and the First Lady.

"It is always a joy to be in the house of God and it is even a greater joy when the service is celebrated and blessed with the anointing of so many bishops from all over our sub-region. I have no doubt that the blessings that have descended on our nation over the last one week that they have been holding their Episcopal Conference here in Accra shall truly fulfil God’s will for the people of Israel as found in Exodus chapter 19 verse 6." 

--- Part of my message to the congregation at the Holy Spirit Cathedral at Adanraka, Accra today Sunday when I joined in a Mass to end the Conference of West African Catholic Bishops in Accra. 

Click here for the full message: http://presidency.gov.gh/node/1146
Ot click below to watch: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6FhpadGw2fU
Let our hopes and aspirations shape our present and the future. When we act in unison, we can create a story of transformation!
Where people respect each other and live in peace, there is progress, and a better world is possible.
This is the surest way to build a sustainable future. Stand with me on this journey.

Received the sad news of an accident involving a M.M.T. Bus on the Kintampo- Tamale road. Condolences to those who've lost loved ones. Emergency services working to attend to injured passengers. Very sad news.

No wall can stand between us, not even the Facebook wall. Use this app, and let’s meet! You’ll be my special guests, and I will take care of everything regarding our meeting – so let’s get in touch!
https://apps.facebook.com/meet-jm/

One of my duties as a leader is to attract new opportunities for Ghana and Ghanaians through international cooperation. This is one of the reasons why I paid a fruitful visit to Iran, at the invitation of Iran’s President, Dr. Hassan Rouhani. 
 
I am proud to be the first African leader to visit Iran after the nuclear agreement, and also the first Ghanaian leader to come here after the Islamic Revolution. Iran has always been a close friend and supporter of the freedom movement in Africa, and supported the fight against colonialism and apartheid. 
 
As members of the Non-Aligned Movement, Ghana and Iran have a longstanding relationship. There are many grounds for cooperation between our countries, including oil and gas, agriculture, power generation, production of cement, home appliances and engineering products. We think Iran enjoys a good advantage in these fields and can become a suitable partner for Ghana.
story: John Dramani Mahama added 10 new photos.

Message:
Yesterday I inaugurated the Kwaobaah-Nyanoa Community Day SHS in the Upper West Akyem District of the Eastern Region. Yet another confirmation of my commitment to increase access to education, and develop a sound infrastructure base that allows for the continuous and sustainable development of our country. 

The decision to invest in infrastructure development may not be popular or politically expedient for some critics, but the goal is to leave a lasting legacy of Ghana’s greatness, and a solid base for Ghana’s future. 

I will continue to invest all my energy into #ChangingLives and #TransformingGhana!
story: John Dramani Mahama added 10 new photos.

Message:
Work has started officially on the Kasoa interchange project. This is a truly transformational project.
 
The construction of the interchange will ease the perennial traffic on the Kasoa-Winneba road, which at its peak time records five kilometers per hour of traffic movement, particularly during weekends. 

The project will be substantially completed by October this year, allowing free movement of vehicles from Accra to the Central Region and vice versa.
story: John Dramani Mahama added 8 new photos.

Message: Italian Prime Minister, Matteo Renzi, has left Accra after a two-day visit. We held very fruitful discussions and I am confident his visit to Ghana will not only strengthen the existing cordial, political and socio-economic ties between Ghana and Italy, but will also confirm Ghana’s international credentials as a sound political environment and one of Africa’s most promising emerging markets.
story: John Dramani Mahama added 10 new photos.

Message: NA
story: John Dramani Mahama updated their cover photo.

Message:
Transparency International has released its annual Corruption Perception Index for 2015. Ghana ranked 56th out of 167 countries and territories, with an overall score of 47. Although the score is slightly lower than the one for 2014, we moved upward when it comes to ranking, from 61st place in the world in 2014, to 56th place.
 
Our fight against corruption is visible. In 2008, Ghana was ranked 67th in the world, and in 2012 it was ranked 64th. Since 2008, we are constantly moving upward, towards the group of less corrupt countries, and that’s a fact. From 2012 until 2015, Ghana climbed up no less than 8 places in the world hierarchy – which, no matter what others might say, is an unparalleled achievement.
 
Ghana today is perceived as less corrupt than important countries like Italy, Greece, Brazil or China. More importantly, Ghana is one of the least corrupt countries in Africa.
 
Of course, we all know that we still have a lot to do when it comes to fighting corruption. All of us, not only the Government, should be more involved in this fight. 
 
Without a doubt, Ghana’s results clearly show that we’re on the right path. For this, I thank all of you. God bless you! God bless our Mother Ghana!
#ChangingLives
#TransformingGhana

I was honoured yesterday to receive, at the Flagstafff House, the new Paramount Chief of Bulsa, Nab Azagsug Azantilow II, together with a delegation from the Builsa Traditional Council in the Upper East Region.
 
In Ghana, everyone contributes to the development of our country. This is why my government will continue to build on its partnership with chiefs to enhance national development.
 
I have always placed a great value on the institution of chieftaincy, and I will continue to cooperate with the chiefs when it comes to the development of their communities, and of our country as a whole. I think this cooperation is fundamental in order to achieve all the objectives that we set up in our agenda for transformation.

#ChangingLives #TransformingGhana
story: John Dramani Mahama added 2 new photos.

Message:
As Co-Chair of the UN Sustainable Development Goals Advocates, I took the floor in Davos at the World Economic Forum 2016. 

I did it with a strong belief in what we, as leaders, have to do. We must work to ensure that the most basic things that so many of us take for granted, are available—not as a privilege, but as a human right—to the millions who currently do not have access to them.

I’m talking about things as basic as clean water and sanitation, health care, food, shelter, clothing and a chance at the one thing that can end the cycle of poverty for a family, a community, even a country—an education. 

The Sustainable Development Goals are the world’s collective admission of that duty. They are a covenant; yes, a social contract for transformation, and a path to bring hope to the world, especially to the less-privileged people.  

They are our understanding that in order for progress to continue, in order for peace to exist, we must first fix what has been broken in this world.
story: John Dramani Mahama added 8 new photos.

Message: NA
story: John Dramani Mahama updated their profile picture.

Message:
I am Co-Chairing, together with the Prime Minister Erna Solberg of Norway, a group of sixteen Sustainable Development Goals Advocates to support the Secretary General of the UN in his efforts to generate momentum and commitment to achieve the SDGs by 2030.

I am humbled by this appointment. To me, it speaks volumes about Ghana’s leadership on the path of sustainable development. It proves not only that we are on the right track, but also that we lead the way. The world is proud of us, and this makes me extremely proud of each and every one of you!

My appointment as Co-Chair of this select UN group also means that Ghana will be able to attract more foreign investments, which in turn will help boost the economy thus, significantly more jobs will become available for Ghanaians.

This is the future we all fought for, and I am honoured to be your leader in this fight! 

God bless you all! God bless our Mother Ghana!

In order to gain new and useful insights, it is important that we listen to one another - truly listen. What I have seen happening too often is people dismissing the viewpoints of others without even listening to what it is they have to say. 

If we continue on this path, we run the risk of creating unnecessary divisions in our country—socially, ethnically, tribally, geographically, politically and even in the arena of religion and faith. And what we sometimes fail to hear is that we are all on the same side. We are all on the side of Ghana.

See the rest of my remarks on the 2016 Meet the Press here:

http://www.presidency.gov.gh/node/1106
story: John Dramani Mahama added 8 new photos.

Message:
173 Senior Secondary Schools across Ghana, plan to have universities in every region, 4 new modern hospitals under construction, numerous polyclinics, distribution of solar lamps to rural communities, the massive gas infrastructure at Atuabo, projected to save the country an estimated $500Million annually in fuel purchases for power plants, huge increases in water delivery to Ghanaians across the country: these are only some of our achievements during the last three years. 

No matter what some may say, these achievements are real, and they provide sustainable progress in everybody’s lives.

 When we empower people by offering them access to water, access to schools, hospitals and polyclinics, people see these things; they see how their lives have changed.

I spent the last weekend in Ho, with my officials. I challenged them to work harder only to build, but also to communicate with people about their work. There have been tremendous progress, and many more good things to come, so every Ghanaian should know about them, and feel proud about them. 

 My brothers and sisters, may God bless all of you! May God bless our Homeland Ghana!
story: John Dramani Mahama added 6 new photos.

Message:
Fellow Ghanaians
My Brothers and Sisters

It gives me great pleasure to join you in bidding farewell to 2015 and welcoming a new year. This is a time for celebration, a time to express gratitude for the good fortune and blessings bestowed upon us throughout the course of this past year, not least of all, the blessings of good health and life itself.

This is also a time for contemplation and analysis. It is a time, as we move forward in our lives, to leave behind the setbacks and limitations of the past because with this New Year come new opportunities and the promises of limitless possibilities.
 
This is is true not only for us as individuals but for us as a nation.

Watch the full message here https://youtu.be/4C1E7CNHDyc
NA
story: John Dramani Mahama added a new photo.

Message: NA
story: John Dramani Mahama added a new photo.

Message: NA
story: John Dramani Mahama added a new photo.

Message:
Yesterday, I joined the end of year party of the Ghana National Fire Service in Accra, which is a first on many levels, since no other sitting President has ever visited the Headquarters of the Service.

I praised our firefighters for their bravery, and I assured them all districts would be equipped with fire stations and tenders to become the best in West Africa. They are already equipped to fight fires and other disasters within an average response time of 10 minutes, unlike the past average of 30 minutes.

This proves beyond doubt that we are on the right track when it comes to building a modern, safer and transformed Ghana.

May all of our firefighters have a Happy New Year!
story: John Dramani Mahama added 4 new photos.

Message:
I thank God for the gift of life, health and the opportunity to share the love of the season with the children of Bole/Bamboi.

See more photos at https://www.flickr.com/photos/fhcommsbureau/albums/72157660471873994 
---JM
story: John Dramani Mahama added 5 new photos.

Message:
Joy to the world. 
Xmas is here. It's a season of love and sharing. 
"The more we share, the more we have".

I thank God for the gift of life, health and the opportunity to share the love of the season with the children of Bole/Bamboi. 

We thank God for his continuous blessing and favour on our nation. 

May we continue to be an oasis of tranquility in all life's storms.

Merry Christmas to all Ghanaians. May the season portend even greater success for ourselves and our country.
---JM

Around this time of the year, we don’t only celebrate, we also look out for those who are less fortunate, those who are weak or lonely. This, my brothers and sisters, is a time of sharing. Because the more we share, the more we have.
 
God blessed me with a wife who inspires me every day. I am humbled by her dedication to less privileged  children, by her love for these little souls, by her unbridled hope in their future. I am very proud of her initiative to always join and share with orphanages across the country. I hope she will inspire many more to do same. 

God bless you, Lordina!
story: John Dramani Mahama added 14 new photos.

Message:
Last night, I launched a book, 'Accounting to the People’. 
Our government is an open one, and I have not only a political obligation, but also a moral duty to keep every Ghanaian informed on where we stand as a nation right now.
 
It is very important for all of us to have a clear overall picture of our achievements, so that we know what remains to be done. In truth, I say to you, Ghana is on the path of recovery and our medium term prospects of becoming an upper middle income country are brighter now than ever in the history of our country.
 
These are Ghanaian achievements, and everyone should be proud of them. Let us all keep working hard. 
#ChangingLives 
#TransformingGhana 

Visit http://www.presidency.gov.gh/sites/default/files/photos/greenbook2015.pdf for your copy of the book.
story: John Dramani Mahama added 5 new photos.

Message:
At the recent Johannesburg Summit of the Forum on China-Africa Cooperation, I met with Chinese President, H.E. Mr. Xi Jinping. Cooperation between Ghana and China has resulted in transformational projects that have significantly propelled Ghana’s economic growth.

For us in Ghana, we look forward to further collaboration leading to increased Chinese involvement especially in the creation of light industries, and the eventually manufacture of Made in Ghana products with Chinese technology and expertise. 

We believe that the next level of cooperation between Africa and China must be reflected by a deep involvement of the private sector. Joint ventures, public private partnerships, and other forms of collaboration involving our private sectors will establish a stronger and more sustainable platform for our partnership.
story: John Dramani Mahama added 9 new photos.

Message: I must go into the 2016 elections with a Running Mate. I have had no difficulties settling on my hardworking Vice President as Running Mate for the Second Term. I am happy to nominate H.E. Kwesi Bekoe Amissah-Arthur as my Running Mate for the 2016 Presidential elections. JM

Today we celebrate Farmers Day, when we express our gratitude towards Ghanaian farmers and fishermen. I congratulate, from the bottom of my heart, this year’s award winners. 

Our farmers hard work and their capacity to improve their skills and their technologies is what has kept us going as a nation since Independence. 

We owe them a lot, and I assure them, government will continue to support their efforts.

#ChangingLives #TransformingGhana

I spoke at the Leaders Event of the UN Climate Change Conference of the Parties (COP 21) in Paris, France.

In Ghana, we have been pondering on our options. We have been seriously considering which strategies would be the most viable, which strategies would realistically create change.    Through these discussions, what comes to light is that in our society the very concept of development is different than that in other societies. We must model our development on clean energy.    

Ghana has submitted its Intended Nationally Determined Contribution (INDC) on our climate change strategy and is determined to achieve ambitious cuts in greenhouse gases.  

Ghana seeks an agreement here in Paris that is binding, measurable and respected by all.

You may read my entire statement here: http://www.presidency.gov.gh/sites/default/files/photos/cop21.pdf
story: John Dramani Mahama added 6 new photos.

Message:
So soon another year of my life has passed. 
I took an oath to dedicate myself to the service and well-being of the people of Ghana, and I stand firmly by that oath. I am humbled by your support, and I thank you all for your kind wishes. 
I will continue to serve all of you with all my heart and soul! May God bless you all! May God bless our homeland Ghana!

At the 2015 Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting in Malta. Very far reaching discussions on the theme 'Adding Global Value', and impactful side events on Climate Change and a session of the CHOGM Small Group Meeting on Anti-Corruption. I join other leaders in congratulating Baroness Patricia Scotland the newly appointed Secretary General Designate of the Commonwealth Secretariat.

Access to healthcare is a fundamental human right. We built hospitals and polyclinics near you, and we will continue to do so. We made sure the underprivileged have access to healthcare too. We put people first, we put you first! We have done all this, but we are aware we still have much more to do. Our journey is not over yet. So let’s continue to change lives! Let’s continue to transform Ghana!

“My brothers and sisters, 
I feel deeply honoured for being endorsed by you as your Presidential Candidate for the 2016 elections. You lift me up, you give me strength!  I thank you for the confidence reposed in me. 

I thank you all for showing that we are the bastion of free democratic expression in Ghana. As President and Candidate, I will do everything in my power to focus on the needs of the Ghanaian people. It is my duty to leave a lasting legacy for our party. 

Transforming any nation is not easy and it does not occur with the stroke of a pen. It takes persuasion, attitudinal change, reorientation, and the right policies and leadership. NDC is offering that leadership.
 
I thank you all for the courage with which you have accompanied me on this mission. I am deeply grateful to each and every one of you. You inspire me, Ghanaians inspire me! “ 

Read my entire statement here: http://www.presidency.gov.gh/node/1072
story: John Dramani Mahama added 4 new photos.

Message:
I’m voting to strengthen democracy in NDC, I am voting for more youth and women to get involved in politics, and for a transparent process to select Ghana’s political leaders. I’m voting for inclusiveness and equality, and for empowering those who otherwise would be powerless.

I’m voting because I believe in all of you!

My brothers and sisters in the NDC, tomorrow we will hold our primaries. We have a great opportunity to show that we are an example of inclusive democracy.
Tomorrow we will prove that NDC is a party in which everyone has a voice. In our party, we are not stuck in power struggles, and everybody has a chance to become a candidate.
 
Empowering the powerless, strengthening equality, giving everyone a voice– these are ideals we hold very dear in the NDC. Let every Ghanaian be inspired by our ideals, let your brothers and sisters in the NDC be proud of you.
 
Let’s go out and vote in tomorrow’s primaries!
Let’s keep Changing Lives!
Let’s keep Transforming Ghana!

Some say they want to wake up and build. Well, we are building already! We are building new roads and improving old ones, we are building Ghana’s IT infrastructure, we are building the telecommunication infrastructure. Our mission is far from being completed.  There is still a tremendous amount of work to be done. 
Let’s keep changing lives!
Let’s keep transforming Ghana!

For me, access to education is vital, and I have been working all these years to improve it. It is the most effective weapon to fight poverty, prejudice and exclusion. A decade and a half into the new millennium, we are providing, through our Basic Education Program, equitable access to good quality, child-friendly, universal Basic Education. Through improvements in infrastructure and quality of teaching, provision of teaching and learning materials, management and supervision of schools, quality and access to basic education is being enhanced. 
You and I are Changing Lives! 
You and I are Transforming Ghana!

Continuing my #ChangingLives & #TransformingGhana Tour, I met with the people of Greater Accra. I told them, and I want to tell all of you, that NDC is a party of peace. There is no room in the 21st century for political violence. For the 2016 elections we will come with a peaceful message. 

We should be proud of our achievements! Everywhere we look, we can see new schools, or better roads, or better access to water. This is change, positive transformation. We achieved all this, we embarked on this road of tremendous transformation because we believe in peace, and we believe in our fellow-Ghanaians. This is what unites us! 

So be brave and work hard, all of you! Let’s keep changing lives! Let’s keep transforming Ghana!
story: John Dramani Mahama added 15 new photos.

Message:
I continued my #ChangingLives & #TransformingGhana Tour. This time, I visited the Northern Region. I asked everyone to keep their heads up, because everybody stands a chance to make a difference and to improve people’s lives. I had to come from one of the remotest areas of the country to lead NDC to victory. This is because NDC as a party is people centered and never discriminate against anybody.

Let me assure all Ghanaians that NDC is a party for ordinary people, unlike other parties where they look at your pedigree!

We are working just like an artist. When artists are working you don’t actually know what they are doing until they finish the work. Those who are saying we are not working are entitled to their opinions, but all Ghanaians would testify to the contrary.

So let’s stay focused and united in brotherly love! Let’s keep changing lives! Let’s keep transforming Ghana!
story: John Dramani Mahama added 20 new photos.

Message: On behalf of the people of Ghana, I send to the families of the victims of these despicable attacks, our condolences. May those who survived be comforted and healed. Ghana stands by a grieving France in this time of difficulty.

Democracy begins with each of us, with our souls striving for a better world where our potential is fully achieved. Democracy is paramount to us as a nation. Every time I think about this, my heart is filled with unspoken joy. Together as a nation we achieved this for Ghana! And the NDC has contributed greatly to putting our democracy on the right track. Now we are a model for democracy in Africa. So let’s keep moving forward and upward! Let’s be proud of our country!
#ChangingLives #TransforminGhana

Our duty as leaders is to create the environment for you to realise  your potential. In business and life your resolve will be tested, you will be confronted by what might seem insurmountable challenges, but always be reminded that the tenacity not to give up and the strength to be unyielding is what will set you on the path to success. Let’s help our youth gain the confidence to transform the future.
#ChangingLives #TransformingGhana

#ChangingLives 
#TransformingGhana

While I was meeting with the people of the Upper West region, I took the opportunity to express my heartfelt creed about politics.

There is no place in our politics for violence. No amount of political power is worth shedding the drop of blood of any single Ghanaian. Politics is not a life and death struggle. Politics is live and let’s live, because this country belongs to all of us, it doesn’t belong to one group of people. So that is how we should handle our politics, by consensus, because we have the same objective.

All of us want the country to be a better place; it’s just that we differ in our approaches in how to do it. So it should not lead us to kill each other. 

I congratulate the people in the Upper West Region for their dedication and hard work. Let me assure all of you that all the good things we did will continue to be done, with even more passion and energy. We owe that to our fellow-Ghanaians! 
#ChangingLives  #TransformingGhana
story: John Dramani Mahama added 10 new photos.

Message:
Last week I continued my #ChangingLives & #TransformingGhana Tour. This time, I met with the people of the Upper East region. I pledged to them that my government will continue to work hard to massively improve the quality of the road network in this region, and to build community high schools in every district. I assured them that their region is going to receive a fair share of development, as we work tirelessly to spread development to deprived and needy communities.

I also met with fellow-NDC members: I reminded all of them that NDC is a family, and as a family we will organize and support the primaries to be held on November 21. We have a moral duty towards all Ghanaians to win the next elections. While we keep transforming Ghana, we need to make sure that the benefits of this transformation are widely distributed, especially among the underprivileged. We owe Ghanaians to win this fight!

To all the beautiful, hardworking people living everywhere in Ghana: I am honored to be your President! May God bless our Mother Ghana! #ChangingLives & #TransformingGhana
story: John Dramani Mahama added 10 new photos from November 9, 2015 at 10:00am.

Message:
A new school is a focal point for community development. Think of the knowledge these children will acquire! Think of the wealth they will create based on this knowledge! Think of the jobs this wealth will bring for every one of us!  Everybody wins when education is promoted. Share to spread the word! 
We are #ChangingLives! We are #TransformingGhana!

We have an achievable goal of exploring alternative sources of energy, particularly Solar as Ghana is blessed with Sunshine. Renewable energy is the key to a better future! 
#ChangingLives #TransformingGhana

I can feel your uncertainty, I know it’s hard, but nothing is easy in modernizing a country and nothing can be done properly without all the necessary steps. We shall begin to see the benefits of the sacrifices that we are making sooner than we would expect. #ChangingLives #TransformingGhana

Over the course of the last years, a tremendous amount of work has been done. Nevertheless, there is a tremendous amount of work that still needs to be done. Together we will build a Ghana that will be a source of pride for all of us. Share to spread the word! 
#ChangingLives  #TransformingGhana

Education remains the surest path to victory over ignorance, poverty and inequality. This is self-evident in the bold initiatives we continue to take to improve access, affordability, quality and relevance at all levels. Share to spread the word!
 #ChangingLives & #TransformingGhana

Today I met with the Prime Minister of India, His Excellency Mr. Shri Narendra Modi, during my visit to India, where I am participating in the India-Africa Summit Forum. We talked about working together to revamp the rail sector, and also about the possibility of developing Ghana’s road infrastructure with Indian investments. Both of us agreed to step up engagement in sectors like agriculture, IT, skill development, cyber security and maritime security. I also had meetings with officials of the Indian EXIM Bank and the CEOs of a number of Indian businesses.

For us, Ghanaians, India is not only a strong partner, but also a close friend. I am sure this long and strong friendship will help push the Agenda for Transformation.
story: John Dramani Mahama added 14 new photos.

Message:
I have just returned from a #ChangingLives & #TransformingGhana Tour. I started in the Western Region, Central Region, Eastern Region, Ashanti, and then to Brong-Ahafo. I met wonderful people everywhere I went, and I made sure all the investments Government is making in these regions are on schedule, because every Ghanaian will benefit from them.

I also went to make sure democracy reigns in our party politics. We recognize that everyone has the right to compete, to participate in a race where the final decision is taken by all the party members. In the NDC, everyone has a voice! We have unity in democracy, and this is what makes our country great! We will continue to work for the development of every region in Ghana!
story: John Dramani Mahama added 31 new photos to the album: President Mahama on a #ChangingLives & #TransformingGhana Tour.

Message: "It remains the resolve of government to Change the Lives of our people and Transform our economy. This is a pledge based on convictions and evidence. It is a pledge based on fellow-feeling and in honour of my social contract with our people." Read my entire statement on End of Poverty Day here:

Today, I joined His Excellency Dr. Jim Yong Kim, President of the World Bank Group, in the pledge to end extreme poverty until 2030.

Ghana has been one of the most successful countries on the continent in meeting the Millennium Development Goals. While we have made significant gains in significantly reducing poverty, we must take advantage of the new Sustainable Goals to launch a major assault on poverty in Africa.

We are the first generation in human history with the unique opportunity to end extreme poverty. Such is our challenge, and such is our opportunity. In my convictions, it is doable and it is within our reach.
story: John Dramani Mahama added 10 new photos.

Message:
We are on the right path! 

The World Bank forecasts a GDP growth of more than 5% for Ghana: 5.9% in 2016, and 7.8% in 2017. The World Bank thus confirms the soundness of my government's economic policies. Our economy has been sufficiently transformed, during these last few years of necessary and often painful reforms, so that it won't fall prey anymore to low prices of commodities on the international market. Prices of commodities are still low, but our economy is getting back on track, as the World Bank’s forecast confirms. Our economy is changing! 
Keep spreading #hope! Let's keep #TransformingGhana!

On Sunday I began a two-day visit to the Western and Central Regions. I started with the Western Region, an area that contributes significantly to the country’s Gross Domestic Product. I came here to inspect ongoing projects by the government, inaugurate the 2nd Community Day SHS and I had meetings with Business Executives as part of my  #ChangingLives tour of the region. People in the Western Region are the living proof that we are on the right path. Ghana is rising again; today we have the fastest growing middle class in Africa. God’s favour was on our country. And May God help us in transforming Ghana! #ChangingLives #TransformingGhana
story: John Dramani Mahama added 8 new photos.

Message:
Every Ghanaian can now help our institutions in their fight against corruption. With the current availability of social media applications and modern video and camera devices embedded in even ordinary mobile phones, everyone can be an Anas. 

As President, I wish to assure you about my commitment to the fight against corruption. I’ll continue to work to strengthen our institutions; especially the anti-corruption institutions will be assisted to carry out their work without fear or favour. You can also be a part of this fight. Let’s keep transforming Ghana!
NA
story: John Dramani Mahama updated their profile picture.

Message: Earlier this month I delivered a speech at the University of South California's Center on Public Diplomacy. I made a presentation on our “Made in Ghana” project and I'm happy to tell you that everybody was extremely interested. Also, I had the pleasure to taste Ghana's cocoa products sold in Los Angeles. Take a look and be proud of yourselves! #MadeinGhana
story: John Dramani Mahama added 6 new photos.

Message: From my interview with France24: “Ghana needs strong institutions, not aggressive leaders. We're in the process of strengthening our public institutions, not only to tackle corruption, but also to improve our democracy and the quality of life for every Ghanaian."

“We're in the process of restructuring our economy, so that a fall in the prices of raw materials on the international market won't be able to affect us anymore. Reforms already implemented made Ghana's economy more robust and resilient than it was only a few years ago. We're on the right path for recovery and growth! “ Watch my full interview for France24 here:

Ghana became today the 50th member of the OECD Development Centre, a select club of countries committed to democracy and economic progress. This means we now have more leverage to find policy solutions to stimulate growth and improve living conditions in Ghana. This is a great step forward for Ghana! 
I am proud of you all, and honoured to be your President!

At the meeting I had this morning with the President of France, Mr. Francois Hollande, he told me that the French government agreed to provide, through the French Development Agency (AfD), a €37.50 million financing for the second phase of the Kumasi Roads and Drainage Extension Project. This involves the construction of the Lake Road/ Oforikrom bypass and the Aboabo drainage works.

These are good news for Ghana! As your President, I pledge to all of you that developing Ghana will always be my first and foremost priority.

This morning I had a very fruitful conversation with France’s President, His Excellency Mr. Francois Hollande, at the Elysee Palace in Paris. 

France is one of our most important European partners. We share a common interest in the security and wellbeing of West Africa. 

Mr. Hollande expressed his appreciation for Ghana’s leading role in ECOWAS and the way we managed the delicate situation in Burkina Faso. 

We know we have an important role in the region, and we will continue our hard work to improve the lives of all West Africans.
story: John Dramani Mahama added 2 new photos.

Message: #ChangingLives #TransformingGhana
story: John Dramani Mahama updated their cover photo.

Message: I am proud to have represented Ghana in the General Assembly of the UN. You can read my entire speech here.

From my speech at UN General Assembly today:
“While we are exposed to the current uncertainty of the international markets, strong cooperation with our multilateral and bilateral partners is seeing positive movement towards fiscal consolidation. Moreover, our current agenda for transformation is aimed at diversifying the economy and accelerating growth.”

From my speech at UN General Assembly today:
“Ghana is considered one of the bright lights of Africa, a place that was once derisively referred to as the dark continent. The nation boasts a strong stable democracy, with an economy that has been growing positively for more than two decades.”

From my speech at UN General Assembly today:
“It is not a secret that when it comes to gender equality, education is the key to change.  It is a problem that must be addressed at its root.  We speak often of ability and access, and those are honorable concepts; but the actuality is that being able to get an education and having access to an education is not the same as getting an education.”

From my speech at UN General Assembly today:
“We must allow ourselves, as people and even more so as nations, to belong to one another.”

From my speech at UN General Assembly today:
"Peace is the presence of dignity in one’s life; it is the achievement of equality in one’s endeavours; and it is the respect of one’s humanity and its attendant rights."

I always supported, and will always support the rule of law and our justice system. What we uncovered these days is that some people, judges, judicial officers and policemen, seemed to be willing to transgress the principles of a fair justice, to their own interest.

Such persons should be subjected to what they, perhaps, denied others: a fair investigation and a fair trial. Sometimes the principles are to be re-learned the hard way, because justice should always be served.

We must also understand that this is a problem of some people who may or may not be guilty: it’s for the investigators and the judges to decide. However, this is not a problem of our judicial system as a whole. This is not something to make us lose our faith in the judicial system. On the contrary, the investigations that began these days prove beyond doubt that our justice system is intact and working, served by many people with integrity and determination.

I urge every one of you to keep faith in the system. Justice will always prevail!

This Sunday, September 27, I delivered a statement at the UN General Assembly Hall in New York, on the adoption of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). The adoption of the SDGs is perhaps the most ambitious, transformational development ever attempted in the history of the United Nations.

I commit to the people of Ghana that I will continue to aggressively and with dynamism implement our country Agenda for Transformation within the framework of the newly adopted SDGs in order to build a life of dignity that ensures no one is left behind.

You can read my entire statement here: http://www.presidency.gov.gh/sites/default/files/photos/sdgspeech.pdf

On Saturday, September 26, I hosted at the UN Summit in New York a forum, “Securing a Healthy Future”. I was honoured by the presence of two great leaders, German Chancellor Angela Merkel and Norwegian Prime Minister Erna Solberg, who co-hosted the event with me.

The three of us launched this initiative at the beginning of the year, to better prepare the world for future global health crises. 

I pleaded for a strong focus on primary healthcare, since it’s my firm belief that this is the best solution to effectively contain epidemics and provide a better life to our people. Ghana is a model for our neighbors in this respect.

From the very beginning I was deeply committed to improve our health system, and I will continue to be so. I am happy that our efforts to improve our country’s health system are now recognized internationally, and I express my wholehearted gratitude to all of you who take part in this effort. 

I am very proud of each and every one of you!

President John Dramani Mahama has arrived in New York, USA, to attend the 70th Session of the United Nations General Assembly. This year's Session is on the theme, "The United Nations at 70- The road ahead for peace, security and human rights."

Ahead of the opening of the General Assembly on Monday, President Mahama will this morning (Friday) participate in the opening of the UN Summit on the Post-2015 Development Agenda, which will adopt the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). He will also attend a plenary session of the UN to be addressed by Pope Francis this morning.

Together with the German Chancellor and the Norwegian Prime Minister, President Mahama will on Saturday host a major side event on Strengthening a healthy future: Resilient Health Systems to fight epidemics and ensure healthy lives, a follow-up to the proposal made by the three world leaders to the UN Secretary General to set up a panel to review the world's response to health crisis.

President Mahama will address the General Assembly on Wednesday September 30th. The address will be live on Ghana Television and Radio Ghana, and via webcast at www.presidency.gov.gh.

---------------
Media Office 
Flagstaff House Communications Bureau
Office of the President
Flagstaff House 
Kanda- Accra 
Ghana

I stated during a visit here in September last year that “This project is much anticipated by Ghanaians. It is going to be a game changer. It would even help our macroeconomic stability in terms of reducing the pressure on our foreign exchange reserves. It would save us almost half a billion dollars a year in light crude purchases, and another billion dollars in foreign exchange savings for the purchase of light crude oil.” 

--- President JD Mahama speaking at a ceremony to inaugurate the Atuabo Gas Processing Plant on September 16, 2015. 

For more photos from Atuabo, click https://www.flickr.com/photos/fhcommsbureau/albums/72157658721092325

Message:
"I am humbled by the enthusiastic support I have received here this afternoon. This is a testament of the faith you have in me as the leader of our party and nation. It is also a dress rehearsal of the overwhelming endorsement that I expect to receive to lead this great party in the 2016 general elections.

“With Christ in our vessel, we shall smile at the storm.
With the support of you the rank and file of our Party and the Good People of Ghana, I look forward to four more years at the Flagstaff House.
Long live the NDC
Long live Ghana"
--- President JD Mahama addressing party supporters after filing his nominations to lead the NDC to the 2016 polls.

Message:
President John Mahama on Sunday met the Functional Executive Committee members of the National Democratic Congress (NDC) to formally inform them of his decision to present his filled presidential nomination form on Monday. 

Mr. Mahama who is the leader of the party told the meeting attended by all members including the National Chairman and General Secretary that his decision to meet and formally inform them of his plans is in line with the strong government- party relations that has been developed. 

Also present at the meeting was Vice President Kwesi Amissah-Arthur who picked the nomination form on behalf of President Mahama last Thursday, and Chief of Staff Julius Debrah. 

Communication from the Office of the President indicates that the President will submit his form tomorrow, Monday, at 4pm after which he will address supporters of the party at the precincts of the NDC National Headquarters in Adabraka. 

See more photos at: https://www.flickr.com/photos/fhcommsbureau/albums/72157658206079916

Message:
Ayeeko! to all who voted. 
District Assemblies are the bedrock of our local governance system.

Message:
President JD Mahama began a 3-day State Visit to the Republic of Mauritius on Monday. 
At the Sir Seewoosagur Ramgoolam International Airport to welcome him were the Prime Minister, Sir Anerood Jugnauth, accompanied by his wife, Lady Sarojini Jugnauth, Deputy Prime Minister Hon. Charles Xavier-Luc Duval, senior government officials and leader of the Opposition in Mauritius. He spent the day holding discussions with the President of Mauritius HE Dr. Ameenah Gurib-Fakim and Prime Minister, Sir Jugnauth, witnessed the signing of agreements between the two countries and attended a Banquet hosted in his honour by the Prime Minister.

Click below to view photos of the President's 3-day State Visit to Mauritius.

"We do not have a perfect media environment. We need to introduce better regulation for the broadcast media to improve our national discourse. 

In our reportage, we must realise that we are no longer reporting for a strictly local audience. We are reporting for a world audience. WWW. is really what it means, and it means the World Wide Web." 

All Ghanaian journalists are winners for contributing to Ghana's democracy. Congratulations to Seth Kwame Boateng & other award winners. 

President JD Mahama at the 20th GJA Awards Ceremony.

https://soundcloud.com/flagstaffhouse/president-jd-mahama-addresses-20th-gja-awards-ceremony

Congratulations to the first 107 YES beneficiaries. Your ideas will not only create jobs but also inspire many more young people. 

#ChangingLives 
#TransformingGhana

Message:
"I recognise the commitment of our two surviving former President’s, the various political parties, our traditional authorities and the clergy to the process. It signals a collaboration that will see to the development of a plan that is acceptable, all-inclusive, and which will tackle our developmental challenges with a common purpose. 
Self-doubt, the ‘Pull Him Down’ Syndrome and cynicism have never, yet, built a nation. We must avoid it at all cost if we wish to live to our fullest potential as a people with a common destiny."

--- President JD Mahama in an address to launch the process for the preparation of a long-term national development plan on August 04, 2015. 

Click to read full speech: http://www.presidency.gov.gh/node/1002

Ghana's new Permanent Representative to the United Nations, Mrs. Martha Ama Pobee has been sworn in by President JD Mahama and given her instrument of office. She is the first female appointee to the position.

You can watch more videos from the Flagstaff House at https://www.youtube.com/user/flagstaffhouse

See our photos at www.flickr.com/photos/fhcommsbureau

Message:
A former Governor of the Ekiti State in the Federal Republic of Nigeria, Dr. Kayode Fayemi, has paid a courtesy call on President JD Mahama. 

Dr. Kayode on July 21 delivered the 3rd President John Atta Mills lecture in Accra.

President John Mahama on Wednesday presented to Mrs. Martha Ama Akyeaa Pobee her letters of credence and instrument of office as Ghana's Permanent Representative to the United Nations. 

She is the first Ghanaian woman to serve as Ghana's representative to the UN, and will be based in New York. 

Click for photos: 
https://www.flickr.com/photos/fhcommsbureau/sets/72157656217099662

President JD Mahama on Friday addressed a Ghana/ Italy Business Forum at the ongoing Milan Expo 2015. The Forum was part of activities for the Ghana Day Celebration at the Expo. Earlier, President Mahama participated in a flag raising ceremony at the Expo Centre to commemorate the Ghana Day. 

Click below for photos:

Message:
President JD Mahama today held separate meetings with Italian Prime Minister Matteo Renzi and President Sergio Mattarella in Rome. 

The closed door meetings with the two Italian leaders focused on the deepening of bilateral relations between the two countries and discussions on a number of issues on which the two countries have shared values and positions. 

President Mahama noted the long years of cooperation between Ghana and Italy from the days of Ghana's first President, Dr. Kwame Nkrumah. 

While acknowledging the large number of Italian civil engineering and construction firms in Ghana, President Mahama said Italy's assistance with Ghana's private sector development efforts with a Fund, continues to support with the promotion of SMEs. The meetings also discussed Ghana's interest in leveraging Italy's experience in Agriculture and Agro Processing, piracy in the Gulf of Guinea. migration and human trafficking.  

President Mahama urged Italy to take advantage of its long engagement with Africa to help other European countries to understand the African situation, and galvanise them to support various initiatives on the continent. This include the fight against terrorists, the quest for peace and stability and the development of migration policies. 

He reminded Italy that it has a stake in helping restore stability to Libya, because of its long standing association with the North African country. 

President Mahama also argued that the world must work to ensure stability in nations. He said with stability, democracy will evolve and flourish. President Mahama said the instability of North Africa could adversely affect the Sahel Region, West Africa and also Central Africa.

Please click for photos from the meetings. https://www.flickr.com/photos/fhcommsbureau/sets/72157655511396789

Thanks #ElwakKeepfit. Great 15km walk. Managed to make it to church this AM despite the aches & pains in leg muscles.

View photos from the walk here... https://www.flickr.com/photos/fhcommsbureau/sets/72157653445888764
President JD Mahama on July 03, 2015 paid a historic visit to the Nsawam Medium Security Prisons to familiarise himself with the conditions in the prisons and also interact with the prisoners.

Message: President JD Mahama in an address at a Luncheon for Senior Citizens to commemorate the 55th Republic Day Anniversary of Ghana.
story: John Dramani Mahama at Banquet Hall, State House.

Message:
"These and many more successes give me cause for hope that our country will be great. We will triumph. We will succeed. Is our glass half empty or it is half full? As a born optimist, I say it is half full. And we can fill it to the brim if we just focus and work together. Yes we have challenges, but who says other countries don’t have challenges as well.
The great Nelson Mandela said; “After climbing a great hill, one only finds that there are many more hills to climb.”

--- President JD Mahama addressing a Senior Citizens Luncheon on the occasion of the 55th Republic Day Anniversary at the State Banquet Hall. 

Click here photos from the Senior Citizens Luncheon- https://www.flickr.com/photos/fhcommsbureau/sets/72157654939445310

Watch a video of the President's Address at https://www.flickr.com/photos/fhcommsbureau/sets/72157654939445310

The President's speech can also be read here- http://www.presidency.gov.gh/node/981

#ChangingLives 
#TransformingGhana

As our Muslim brothers and sisters begin the holy month of Ramadan, I urge them to use the period to purify their hearts and detoxify their bodies with the view to drawing closer to the Almighty Allah, per the teachings of Prophet Mohammad (Sallallahu Alayhi Wa’Sallam). 
The nation also expects our Muslim brothers and sisters during this period of fasting to totally submit to Allah and to remember our beloved country in their prayers. Let us all, as Ghanaians, lend support to our Muslim colleagues to enable them fulfill the requirements of the month of Ramadan.

#ChangingLives 
#TransformingGhana

story: John Dramani Mahama updated their cover photo.

Message:
"We have gathered today, those of us here in body, and countless others across the width and breadth of this nation who are joining us in heart, mind and spirit.  We have come together as one, to mourn those whose lives were lost to the disasters of that fateful day.

"The loss that our nation has suffered is incomprehensible. 
The search and rescue mission is over and the provisional death toll has so far been placed at 152. That’s 152 human lives—mothers, fathers, brothers, sisters, children."

--- President JD Mahama speaking at a National Memorial Service to end 3days of national mourning for victims of the June 3 flood and fire disaster in Accra. 

Read the full address at http://www.presidency.gov.gh/node/969

Photos of the memorial service are also available at https://www.flickr.com/photos/fhcommsbureau/sets/72157652029939034

story: John Dramani Mahama updated their cover photo.

Message:
"There have naturally been resultant effects, including destruction of buildings, washing away of vehicles with passengers in them, and many victims drowned in the resultant floods.

"Many other Ghanaians were trapped in the traffic chaos that occurred as a result of the high water in many areas.
A tragedy of this magnitude requires a strong and concerted response and that is what government and many Ghanaians are currently offering.

"Our security and emergency services and indeed Ghanaians have all joined hands and in a spirit of unity and are offering support to victims of these disasters."
--- President JD Mahama speaking after a National Crisis & Emergency Meeting at the Flagstaff House on June 4, 2015. 

Watch https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mupO8Fb7BE0

Listen to the President @ https://soundcloud.com/flagstaffhouse/president-speaks-on-june-3-disaster-outlines-relief-measures

Read the speech @ http://www.presidency.gov.gh/node/961

Message:
On May 18, 2015, I joined the people of Ho in the Volta Region to inaugurate the completed 800km fibre-optic broadband project, which extends from Ho through the northern part of the region, through parts of the Northern Region to Bawku in the Upper East Region. 

#ChangingLives #TransformingGhana.

Message:
“Roads are important because they move, not only passengers and goods but also agricultural products and if you don’t have good roads to be able to move the products to the market then the farmers suffer and also the prices of agricultural products and food products in the market centres will go very high.” 

#ChangingLives #TransformingGhana 
--- President JD Mahama speaking to journalists after an inspection of ongoing work on the Accra- Kumasi dualisation project, in & around Suhum in the Eastern Region. 

See more photos of the tour here... https://www.flickr.com/photos/fhcommsbureau/sets/72157653143025928
